meanings.definition: To be in a particular situation or place
meanings.sent1: She steaded herself on the edge of the chair.
meanings.sent2: The cat steaded itself on the windowsill to watch the birds.
meanings.sent3: The toy car steaded itself at the top of the ramp before zooming down.
meanings.sent4: His heart steaded as he approached the finish line of the race.
meanings.sent5: The sun steaded in the sky, casting a warm glow over the landscape.

meanings.definition: To provide with a place to live or work
meanings.sent1: The kind farmer steaded the lost puppy in his cozy barn.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent steaded the young couple in their first home.
meanings.sent3: The treehouse steaded the children high above the ground, away from the adults.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse steaded the sailors during the storm, guiding them safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin steaded the tired travelers, offering warmth and shelter.

meanings.definition: To act as a substitute or replacement
meanings.sent1: The teacher steaded the absent student by assigning a classmate to help.
meanings.sent2: The backup generator steaded the power supply during the blackout.
meanings.sent3: The stand-in actor steaded the lead role in the play when the star fell ill.
meanings.sent4: The spare tire steaded the car's journey after a flat tire on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The second chef steaded the kitchen when the head chef was called away on an emergency.
